name: Introduction to Cultural Studies
description: An overview of the field of Cultural Studies, this course introduces students to the various theories and approaches used in the field and looks at how they can be used to analyze culture.

name: Cultural Theory
description: This course examines the fundamental theories of Culture Studies, looking at the works of key theorists such as Raymond Williams, Pierre Bourdieu, and Michel Foucault. It also looks at the implications of these theories for understanding contemporary culture.

name: Advanced Cultural Theory
description: This course builds on the introductory Cultural Theory course by exploring more advanced topics in the field. Topics include post-structuralism, postmodernism, and feminism.
